intro: Stenogyne sessilis var. hexanthoides, commonly known as the Hawaiian hexanthoides, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and coastal areas. It has a compact growth habit with short, upright stems and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
